title: 113_s892
content: The Act titled "Iran Sanctions Loophole Elimination Act of 2013" imposes sanctions on certain transactions in foreign currencies under the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012. The "Iran Sanctions Loophole Elimination Act of 2013" authorizes the President to prohibit foreign financial institutions from opening or maintaining correspondent accounts in the US and impose sanctions on those involved in significant currency transactions with Iran. The "Iran Sanctions Loophole Elimination Act of 2013" allows the President to sanction individuals or entities involved in transactions with designated Iranian financial institutions or persons under specific acts, regardless of the currency used. The President has the authority to waive the application of these sanctions. The President can waive sanctions under the "Iran Sanctions Loophole Elimination Act of 2013" for up to 180 days if deemed vital to national security. A report must be submitted to congressional committees at least 7 days before the waiver takes effect. The section allows transactions in the currency of the country where the person is operating for the sale of agricultural commodities, food, medicine, or medical devices. Definitions for terms like 'account', 'correspondent account', and 'payable-through account' are provided. The term 'agricultural commodity' is defined as per the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978. The terms 'foreign financial institution', 'Iranian financial institution', 'medical device', and 'medicine' are defined in specific regulations. The term 'transaction' is broadly defined to include various types of financial activities. The text discusses the broad definition of the term 'transaction' to include different financial activities, such as foreign exchange swaps and derivatives. Amendments are made to the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012 to include new sections related to transactions. The text introduces new sanctions on certain foreign currency transactions under Sec. 220A.
